etymologies: late Middle English; earliest use found in Robert Mannyng (d. c1338), poet and historian. From the name of Sodom + -ic

definitions: Of or relating to the city of Sodom. Also: of the nature of, or engaging in, a form of sexual intercourse (especially homosexual anal intercourse) characterized as unnatural or immoral, or otherwise culturally stigmatized.

notes.text: For more details on the forms of sexual intercourse that may be implied by this and related words, see note at "sodomy".
